'''Crobat''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''クロバット''' ''Crobat'') is a dual-type {{2t|Poison|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Golbat}} when [[level]]ed up with high [[friendship]]. It is the final form of {{p|Zubat}}.

==Biology==
Crobat is a purple, bat-like Pokémon. This Pokémon's pointed ears are long, and appear to lack insides, while its mouth is small and usually has its teeth bared. Crobat's eyes are red with yellow scelera. It has two pairs of wings; one smaller pair is located near its stubby feet, and a second pair on its shoulders has greenish-blue undersides and two stubby 'fingers'. The hind pair of wings developed from legs, and can still function as such. This allows it to rest by hanging on a tree branch with its rear wings.

If Crobat is flying by fluttering only one pair of wings, it is proof that it has been flying a long distance. By alternately resting its front and rear wings, it can fly all day without having to stop. Crobat is a [[Nocturnal Pokémon|nocturnal]] Pokémon that is typically found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Cave Pokémon|caves}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Brock Crobat.png|220px|thumb|left|Crobat in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Brock's Crobat]]====
{{an|Brock}} had a Crobat that he originally caught as a {{p|Zubat}}. It reached its final evolutionary form in ''[[EP196|Control Freak!]]''. He eventually gave it to his brother [[Forrest]].

====Other====
Several Crobat appeared in ''[[DP071|Pokémon Ranger and the Kidnapped Riolu! Part One]]'', employed by [[J's henchmen]].

A Crobat appeared in ''[[XY134|The Right Hero for the Right Job!]]'', under the ownership of [[Xerosic]]. It battled against some of {{an|Clemont}}'s Pokémon, but eventually lost. Crobat appeared again in ''[[XY139|Facing the Needs of the Many!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
Crobat made a small appearance in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]'' as one of the Pokémon {{OBP|Darkrai|M10}} hit with a {{m|Dark Void}} when a group of Trainers were attacking him.

A Crobat appeared in ''[[DP043|Malice In Wonderland!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Crobat appeared in ''[[XY077|A Relay in the Sky!]]'' participating in the [[Pokémon Sky Relay]].

==In the manga==
[[File:Janine Crobat Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Crobat in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Darkrai Mission Story: Pokémon Ranger Vatonage - the Comic manga===
A Crobat appeared in [[PRV2]].

Another one appeared in [[PRV3]] under the ownership of [[Heath]].

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Janine used a Crobat against Suicune in ''[[PS136|Crossing Crobat]]''. After Suicune countered its first attack, Janine ordered Crobat to use Double Team. Suicune was able to see through this as well, however, due to the shadow cast by the real Crobat and Janine, and Crobat was frozen.

In ''[[PS150|Chinchou in Charge]]'', a herd of Crobat, Zubat, and Golbat attacked [[Misty]], [[Brock]], and [[Erika]] in the [[Tohjo Falls]].

A Crobat was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]] in ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]''.

{{adv|Giovanni}} is later seen with a Crobat in ''[[PS282|Going Green]]'', presumably picked up during his solo training journey.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
A Crobat was shown under the ownership of [[Jupiter]] which evolved from her {{p|Golbat}} prior to ''[[DPA14|A Novel Test!!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Gotta Catch 'Em All manga===
[[Asuka and Maya|Asuka]] is shown with a Crobat.

====Trophy information====
''A Bat Pokémon that evolves from {{p|Golbat}}, Crobat's hind legs have evolved into a second pair of wings, which allows it to fly at great speeds but limits its ability to rest. The affection a Golbat has for its {{pkmn|Trainer}} is vital for the evolution process: if a novice Trainer has a Crobat, it shows that he or she cares for Pokémon well.''

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon has the same [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|type combination]] as Crobat and its pre-evolutions.
* Crobat shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Zubat}}, {{p|Golbat}}, and {{p|Woobat}}. They are all known as the Bat Pokémon.
* Crobat's color scheme is the reverse of {{p|Golbat}}'s. This also applies to its {{Shiny}} variation.
* Crobat's evolutionary line has several similarities with {{p|Swoobat}}'s. All of the members of the lines are based on bats and reach their respective final evolutionary form by [[friendship]].
* Crobat and {{p|Vibrava}} are the only Pokémon of their [[List of Pokémon by body style|body type]] that are not {{type|Bug}}.
** Additionally, Crobat is the only Pokémon of its {{DL|List of Pokémon by body style|Pokémon with two or more pairs of wings|body type}} that is not in the {{egg3|Bug}}.

===Origin===
Crobat is based on a {{wp|bat}}, with elements of {{wp|vampire bat}}s and {{wp|vampire}}s.

====Name origin====
Crobat may be a combination of ''cross'' and ''{{wp|bat}}''. Alternatively, it may be a corruption of ''{{wp|Acrobatics|acrobat}}'', describing Crobat's maneuverability in the air.
